{"id":1128768078,"question_id":3140,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"5 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1703584597,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1128768078/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Count Visited Nodes in a Directed Graph","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public int[] countVisitedNodes(List<Integer> edges) {\n        int n = edges.size();\n        \n        int[] res = new int[n];\n\n        \n        HashMap<Integer, Integer> memo = new HashMap<>();\n        for(int i=0; i<n; i++){\n            Set<Integer> set = new HashSet<>();\n            Queue<Integer> q = new LinkedList<>();\n            q.offer(i);\n\n            int step = 0;\n            while(!q.isEmpty()){\n                int p = q.poll();\n                \n                if(set.add(p)==false){\n                    break;\n                }\n\n                int next = edges.get(p);\n                if(memo.containsKey(next)){\n                    step += memo.get(next);\n                    break;\n                }\n\n                q.offer(next);\n                // System.out.println(i + \" \" + p);\n\n                step++;\n            }\n\n            memo.put(i, step);\n\n            res[i] = step;\n\n        }\n\n        return res;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"count-visited-nodes-in-a-directed-graph","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
